diff_hunk:
@@ -147,7 +147,7 @@ done
 # Get N_WORKERS by WORKER_HOSTS
 N_WORKERS=$(echo ${WORKER_HOSTS} | awk -F "," '{printf NF}')
 # Replace the delimiter with " "
-WORKER_ARRAY=$(echo ${WORKER_HOSTS} | awk -F "," '{for(i=1;i<=NF;i++){printf $i" "}}')
+WORKER_ARRAY=($(echo ${WORKER_HOSTS} | awk -F "," '{for(i=1;i<=NF;i++){printf $i" "}}'))
body: The right way for assign bash array: `array=(var1 var2 var3)`, spliting by space. It's obvious that the old `WORKER_ARRAY` gets a string instead of an array. The same as `PS_ARRAY`.
body_html: The right way for assign bash array: array=(var1 var2 var3), spliting by space. It's obvious that the old WORKER_ARRAY gets a string instead of an array. The same as PS_ARRAY.
body_text: The right way for assign bash array: array=(var1 var2 var3), spliting by space. It's obvious that the old WORKER_ARRAY gets a string instead of an array. The same as PS_ARRAY.
